items.title: Roefs imponeert weer: 'Misschien wel de beste aankoop van het seizoen'
items.summary: Robin Roefs blijft ook in het nieuwe kalenderjaar imponeren bij Sunderland. De sluitpost hield met The Black Cats Manchester City op een doelpuntloos gelijkspel en daar had de Nederlander een groot aandeel in, vonden de Engelse media.

items.title: Today on Sky Sports Racing: Quddwah headlines in Zabeel Mile
items.summary: We have a busy dayâ€™s racing on Friday with flat action from Wolverhampton and Meydan, live on Sky Sports Racing.

items.title: De volgende generatie iconen: 50 supertalenten op een rij
items.summary: Het mooie van voetbal is dat er altijd weer nieuwe sterren opstaan. items.title: Bashir and Potts named in England squad for fifth Ashes Test
items.summary: Spinner Shoaib Bashir and seam-bowler Matthew Potts have been included in England's 12-player squad for the fifth Ashes Test against Australia, with Gus Atkinson ruled out.

items.title: Senegalese bond hekelt geruchten over spanningen met bondscoach
items.summary: De Senegalese voetbalbond FSF hekelt in een verklaring de berichtgeving over spanningen tussen de bond en bondscoach Pape Thiaw tijdens het toernooi om de Afrika Cup.

items.title: Khawaja hits out at â€˜racial stereotypesâ€™ after announcing retirement
items.summary: Usman Khawaja has hit out against a culture of "racial stereotypes" in coverage of Australian cricket, declaring the sport is "still very white" as he announced his international retirement.

items.title: 'AS Roma hoopt op Salah, Liverpool aast op verdediger Club Brugge'
items.summary: In dit blog vind je alle speculaties en bevestigde transfers in het buitenland. Bekijk hier ons blog voor de transferperikelen in Nederland.

items.title: Guardiola ziet ploeg falen in afronding: 'Waren niet eens moeilijke kansen'
items.summary: Pep Guardiola baalde na afloop van het gelijkspel van Manchester City op bezoek bij Sunderland vooral van het grote aantal gemiste kansen. De Spanjaard zag zijn ploeg genoeg creÃ«ren, maar falen in de afronding.

items.title: Pep Guardiola urges Manchester City players to get â€˜heads upâ€™ for visit of Chelsea
items.summary: Manager calm after â€˜really good gameâ€™ at Sunderland Chelsea visit Etihad on Sunday after sacking Maresca An outwardly sanguine Pep Guardiola suggested he was reasonably content with a hard-fought point at Sunderland after watching his Manchester City side lose ground on Arsenal at the top of the Premier League. The 0-0 draw at the Stadium of Light leaves City second, four points behind Mikel Artetaâ€™s leaders but Guardiola was not too downhearted. â€œIâ€™ll take the point against this team at this stadium,â€ said a good-humoured Guardiola who seemed unaffected by reports that Enzo Maresca, once his assistant at the Etihad Stadium, had discussed the possibility of relocating to Manchester later this year with figures associated to City. â€œIt was a really good game.â€ Continue reading...

items.title: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
items.summary: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?

items.title: Chelsea confirm Maresca exit amid poor PL run
items.summary: Chelsea confirmed Thursday they have parted ways with manager Enzo Maresca ahead of Sunday's game against Manchester City.

items.title: Pep says Rodri 'changed the game' in City return
items.summary: Pep Guardiola said Rodri showed Manchester City what they have been missing for a year and a half after the Ballon d'Or winner's substitute performance during a goalless draw at Sunderland.

items.title: Liverpool disappointed as unbeaten run goes to 8
items.summary: Arne Slot described Liverpool's 0-0 draw with Leeds United as a "disappointment" despite his team extending their unbeaten run to eight games in all competitions.

items.title: City lose ground to Arsenal with Sunderland draw
items.summary: Sunderland extended their unbeaten Premier League home record to 10 games after holding Manchester City to a goalless draw.

items.title: 'We are not happy' - Man City fall behind Arsenal in title race
items.summary: Pep Guardiola questioned whether it was only a two-horse Premier League title race, but his Manchester City side can ill-afford many slip-ups in their quest to hunt down leaders Arsenal.

items.title: 'Heavy metal? It's not even aluminium foil football'
items.summary: As Liverpool are booed off following a goalless draw against Leeds, it was hardly the start to the New Year that Arne Slot's side would have wanted.

items.title: Thomas Frankâ€™s Spurs booed off after toiling to point on his Brentford return
items.summary: There was an extraordinary moment just before kick-off here when Thomas Frank strode 20 yards on to the pitch and applauded all four corners of the stadium. The Tottenham head coach was applauded back by the Brentford fans because he will always be a hero to them. His work over a near seven-year period as their manager has seen to that. But what of the followers in his new gig, which began when he said farewell to the Gtech last summer? It is safe to say the jury remains out after this driest of January performances had the supporters in the away enclosure adapting a barb they have historically reserved for Arsenal. â€œBoring, boring Tottenham,â€ they chorused in the 85th minute. Continue reading...

items.title: Brentford draw with 'boring' Spurs on Frankâ€™s return
items.summary: Brentford were held to a goalless draw with Tottenham on Thomas Frankâ€™s return to his former club as Spurs supporters sang "boring, boring Tottenham" at the Gtech Community Stadium.

items.title: New year, same problems for a Liverpool side lacking depth, dynamism
items.summary: Devoid of the swagger that marked last season's title run, Liverpool's draw with Leeds showed how much work remains for Arne Slot.

items.title: Rosenior leading contender for Chelsea job
items.summary: Strasbourg boss Liam Rosenior is the leading contender to be the next Chelsea manager, but others remain under consideration.
